messages.message: Hi @Aimé, @Venkatesh and @Matt Weaver, update on the encrypt/decrypt work I’ve being doing: I’ve added run time parameters handling to the two flows. The flows can be run from binaries now with. Next if for me to understand how to share / deploy the solution at NatWest.
ooo I can help with that!
Can you send me the link to the binaries in your space on IB? I can add to NatWest. Then you can show Song from NatWest how to use?
Also be good to know we have tested on IB and peer reviewed before we ship to Customer. Can someone help you test that Seb?
Nice, let me compile two new binaries. Still need to test on few more things like using encrypted or password protected private key
I’m meeting Matt this afternoon, we can focus on reviewing it then.

@Aimé, my repo project is at https://instabase.com/Sebastien.Durand/my-repo/fs/Instabase%20Drive/EncryptDecryptFlows/
I’ve compiled the two binaries which you’ll find under the build folder. Can you please explain for future reference how you usually go from here to deploy at NatWest? thanks
I’ll work on a readme markup page now to describe the solution configuration and use
awesome! Talk to Matt about adding this Sol to Marketplace as well as an app? or dev packages tool? Should share at next CS meet up as well :slightly_smiling_face:
Once QA tested and peer reviewed, I think it’s a good idea to publish it :slightly_smiling_face:
It needs tested definitely, just seen few issues with the binaries just compiled, will get it ready
ok sweet :slightly_smiling_face: TY

Hi @Venkatesh, the binaries work as long as I provide the runtime config, otherwise it reverts to the default found from the _resources folder, this is the bit I need to understand about packaging and binary deployment:_  if I need to use the clients.resource_reader to read from _resources folder for default configs, should I copy the _resources folder to the binaries location?

@Venkatesh, this is what I get when running the binary without configs (i.e. it uses the resource reader but throws an error coming from celery-app-task stating that the clients.resource_reader.load_file is not implemented), although it works from a direct Flow execution !!:
Exception around resource_reader.load_file: load_file
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File “scripts/encrypt_udf.py”, line 308, in custom_prep_fn
  File “/instabase/workers/celery-app-tasks/py/instabase/resource_utils/resource_reader.py”, line 28, in load_file
    raise NotImplementedError(‘load_file’)
NotImplementedError: load_file

and this is what I can see from github:

So why is the resource reader working from a Flow execution, but not from a Flow binary execution ? in the latter case it seems to use the abstract ResourceReader and not the FlowResourceReader which has the load_file function implemented.

@Seb I think for a resource reader to work, you have to package the flow binary as an .ibsolution (marketplace app) for it to work.
Is this right @Kerry @Venkatesh?
So @Aimé, @Matt Weaver, when sharing the binaries to NatWest, we do it as an packaged IB solution?
We can do either. I can send them scripts, binaries, dev tool packages, marketplace apps… So tell me when you are ready to ship and how you will ship and I can get it on their env

The script version (i.e. to be executed from Flow) is ready, I just have that issue with resource readers when executing an ibflowbin without runtime config (i.e. using default resources) , I’ll review this with @Venkatesh.

@Aimé, @Matt Weaver, I just had a quick crash course with Venkat on how to package the flow binaries as ib solutions. For reference, the use of resource_reader will only work for Solutions, Flows and Refiner, when using a binary directly it will revert to the abstract resource reader causing the problem I’ve seen earlier. So in a nutshell, I’ll share the apps as compiled ib solutions. Kudos to @Venkatesh for coaching me.
@Matt Weaver This can actually serve as a full scale app if we can build a UI for it and have both he encrypt and decrypt features on a single page
@Venkatesh that would be awesome. What would be the effort?
Now that the backend flows are ready, we just need a UI to call those flows. An UI expert could do it in a day or two max
Can this be done via recipebook + react?
Yes
We can take cues from the comparison app
That would be good to see how this is done
ah yes, is it Swathy who is the UI expert then?

Yes. Need to check on her bandwidth though
cc: @Balaram
